title: Load a class with @ConfigMapping or @ConfigProperties annotations with a file other than application.properties.
body:
### Description

Hello guys.

In spring it is possible to load a class with data from a specific file. whether it is inside or outside the resource folder. it would be interesting to have this configuration in quarkus too. This would avoid polluting the application.properties

spring examples:

Config class:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11635050/184706738-794d93c1-6b97-4136-a1a0-a73f961cb723.png)

application.properties
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11635050/184706935-c332d6d0-ef8d-4af1-8f10-ec3bc953dc62.png)

config file in classpath
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11635050/184707413-575501d6-d557-46e6-9a1e-e56ad5cce0ef.png)

config external file
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11635050/184707319-e1b6ecd4-7832-48ea-a943-c64d3621485c.png)


### Implementation ideas

The idea would be to create an attribute in the annotation pointing to the specific file.

Example:
@ConfigMapping(prefix = "config", file="file-watcher-config.yml")
